intro: Maerua calophylla, commonly known as the African snowball, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white, showy flowers that bloom in spring, giving it a snowball-like appearance. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are typically pubescent, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Maerua calophylla is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a hardy plant in regions with limited rainfall.
